page.title: 14A VIEW OF SIDDINGTON VILLAGE
page.content: Siddington is not one of those pretty Cotswold Villages loved by the tourist rather a loose collection of small houses in every style of building,from the 15th to 20th centuries.The two or three larger houses are occupied by "incomers".Once there were two villages Upper and lower Siddington each with its own church,each guarding its identity.Now one Siddington is almost a suburb of Cirencester,united in its resolution to stay a village.It has a church,school,Village-Hall,shop, pub,playing field and post office.It has a large working-class population, but few work here since farming uses machines instead of men.Living in Siddington is like being in a large family.Some of the people have lived here in their forefathers for many generations.They know,help and respect each other.
